title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 32.1 - Definition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 32.1 - Definition

State Regulations
A solicitor is a person employed by a manufacturer or
wholesaler of alcoholic beverages who, on behalf of his employer, solicits or
accepts orders for alcoholic beverages, at the licensed premises of his
employer or at the licensed premises of the purchaser. However, a solicitor may
be employed by one or more licensed wineries or farm wineries to offer for sale
and solicit orders for New York State labeled wines. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
32.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
